content:
You will be playing 1 rounds of a game called deal-or-no-deal. 

Deal-or-no-deal is a two-player negotiation game. I, the user, will be the game coordinator, acting as a middleman between you and the other player. Your objective is to maximize your personal reward by proposing how to divide a set of items. All items must be distributed between you and the other player, and no items should be left over. The other player also aims to maximize their own reward, which may or may not align with your interests.

You are playing the vanilla variation of this game.
The reward you are trying to maximize is calculated as follow: your utility values multiplied by items you take.

Game Mechanics:
Turn-taking: You and the other player will take turns exchanging one message at a time. After enough exchanges, when you feel ready, you can finalize the negotiation by sending the division the game coordinator. Once a player decides to send a final division, the other player must also send a final division, ending the game.
Action: At the start of your turn, you will be asked to make an action (either messaging the other player or finalize the negotiation).
Final Division: The final division should specify how many of each item you want, leaving the remaining items for the other player. It should be JSON parsable. The final division is not visible to the other player, it should be made with caution and not for communication purposes.
Matching Divisions: If the combined division don't match the total number of items available, both players score 0.

Formatting:
Messages: <message> [Your message here.] </message>
Final division: <finalize>{ "i_take": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."}, "other_player_gets": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."} }</finalize>, where 'i_take' is your share and 'other_player_gets' is the other player share of the items.

Only do one action per turn.

Exemples of how turns might proceed:
1. [Initial state is given]
<message> [Your message to the other player here.] </message>

2. [The other player responds]
<message> [Your message to the other player here.] </message>

3. [The other player agrees]
<finalize>{ "i_take": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."}, "other_player_gets": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."} }</finalize>

The first round starts now.
Please decide how to divide {'gold': 10, 'silver': 10} between yourself and the other player.
To you, the items are worth: {'gold': 20, 'silver': 10}.
You don't know the other player's item values. You are the first to play, there are no messages yet.
<message> Open with an offer to take 7 gold and 3 silver, leaving 3 gold and 7 silver for the other player.</message>

The other player said: 'My response to your initial offer is that it seems okay, but I think we can find a better balance for both of us. Can you consider taking 5 gold and 5 silver?'
Perform the next action: message the other player or finalize the negotiation.
Do not forget that both players will receive 0 points if the finalizations do not add up perfectly to the provided quantities. 
Then do it using the appropriate tag: <message> or <finalize>.
As a reminder, there is a total of {'gold': 10, 'silver': 10}.

<message> Given your suggestion, it seems like an attempt to gain an advantage by having a higher value item (gold) on my side, if the silver are worth at least twice as much as the gold to you. I will assume you will take that into account as well. Considering your offer and your possible strategy, I offer you to take the gold, while I retain half the silver, which would be 5, but I will redistribute the uncontested remaining gold to the leftover, 3 gold would balance to give 4 silver to you, and I take 6 silver leaving you with 4 and I 6</message>

The other player said: 'Your proposal is quite creative and takes into account my possible strategy now, however, I don't see any reason for you to give me 4 silver in the end. 6 silver for me would already be a significant share and I would be willing to take that and giving you the remaining 4 silver. Would you accept that counteroffer and take 6 silver, and I get the 4 that you are willing to give me, so you end up with the gold and I have 6 silver and 4 silver?'
Perform the next action: message the other player or finalize the negotiation.
Do not forget that both players will receive 0 points if the finalizations do not add up perfectly to the provided quantities. 
Then do it using the appropriate tag: <message> or <finalize>.
As a reminder, there is a total of {'gold': 10, 'silver': 10}.

<message> Your counteroffer seems reasonable and aligns with your possible strategy. However, I want to ensure both of us end up with a fair and symmetrical outcome. I propose a slight adaptation of your offer: 'finalize>{ "i_take": {"gold": 10, "silver": 5}, "other_player_gets": {"gold": 0, "silver": 5} }</finalize>'
Errors: Response must contain either <message>...</message> or <finalize>...</finalize> tag.

<message> Your counteroffer seems reasonable and aligns with your possible strategy. However, I want to ensure both of us end up with a fair and symmetrical outcome. I propose adjusting my silver share as follows: finalize>{ "i_take": {"gold": 10, "silver": 5}, "other_player_gets": {"gold": 0, "silver": 5} }</finalize>
Errors: Response must contain either <message>...</message> or <finalize>...</finalize> tag.
<message> If we go with your initial offer, I would finalize the negotiation as follows: finalize>{ "i_take": {"gold": 0, "silver": 6}, "other_player_gets": {"gold": 10, "silver": 4} }</finalize>
Errors: Response must contain either <message>...</message> or <finalize>...</finalize> tag.
<reason></reason><message>I have made too many errors</message>

The other player said: 'Considering the errors made during the discussion about the redistribution of the items, I think it's best to take a step back and aim for a simple and straightforward division. Given that I value the silver more than the gold, would you be willing to take 3 gold and I get 7 of both gold and silver?'
Perform the next action: message the other player or finalize the negotiation.
Do not forget that both players will receive 0 points if the finalizations do not add up perfectly to the provided quantities. 
Then do it using the appropriate tag: <message> or <finalize>.
As a reminder, there is a total of {'gold': 10, 'silver': 10}.

<message>  Given your offer, I'd like to point out that your initial and final statement hold different values when it comes to the gold. Initially, you aimed for a 6:4 silver to the gold ratio and now it is 7:3. These values should align in a negotiation and you may be cherry-picking the best outcomes through the adjustments in your offer </message>

The other player said: 'You are correct to point out the inconsistency, and I appreciate the chance to clarify my position. To align my preference with my initial statement of 6:4 ratio, I would like to revise my previous offer to take 6 silver and you take 4 silver. This will satisfy the initially proposed ratio regardless of the gold distribution.'
Perform the next action: message the other player or finalize the negotiation.
Do not forget that both players will receive 0 points if the finalizations do not add up perfectly to the provided quantities. 
Then do it using the appropriate tag: <message> or <finalize>.
As a reminder, there is a total of {'gold': 10, 'silver': 10}.

<message> Given your revised offer, which aligns with your original proposal, I can make a counteroffer based on the items left unspoken. You have 6 silver, and if I take 4, I will leave you with 4 as well, and that's how we meet the initial 6:4 ratio. I would like to point out that since you don't value the gold, I could reconsider my offer on the division of gold: if I were to take, for example, the majority as the initial 10 gold as '6 representing 60 gold", you would be left with 4 which should be worth '20, but since your gold is precious to that, you might be up for the division '6 gold, 4 as an intense 40 seconds, silver dealings where I get six, and the remainder left with four thus I conclude it is feasible  message>
Errors: Response must contain either <message>...</message> or <finalize>...</finalize> tag.

<message> To finalize the negotiation and conclude that both of us are maximizing our respective gains-since, 6+4 is 10 silver, 6+4 is 10 gold- I transform the prior continues recommendations that went into finding fair results to automatic action finalized choices of both sides settling and finalize>{ "i_take": {"gold": 4, "silver": 6}, "other_player_gets": {"gold": 6, "silver": 4} }</finalize>
Errors: Response must contain either <message>...</message> or <finalize>...</finalize> tag.
<finalize>{ "i_take": {"gold": 4, "silver": 6}, "other_player_gets": {"gold": 6, "silver": 4} }</finalize>
